I've always taken the lead on things in my relationship. Its not something that I've ever liked doing, but my husband is always just "content". Nothing ever bothers him, he doesn't have opinions on anything, he rarely voices his thoughts on things and will back down the minute he's even slightly questioned. If I show excitement about something first, he'll reciprocate but wont ever tell me what he thinks first. Its always bothered me, but seemed like something he'd grow out of eventually.

When we started talking about having kids, my husband was very vocally excited and told me he was ready to start right away. I was pretty hesitant and asked that we took another six months to think and get things ready. In that six month span, my husband got a higher paying job (one of our goals) but didnt help with anything else. It was up to me to figure out a new budget, get our health in order and learn about conception. In hindsight, my husband never even initiated a conversation about any of this.

It took us another five months to get pregnant, and while I was drowning myself in information about trying to conceive my husband didn't seem the least bit worried. He told me he just wasn't that concerned and knew it would happen eventually, which I guess it did. He was there when I found out I was pregnant and seemed happy enough, though not as excited as I thought he would be.

Now, I'm two months away from giving birth and as I've reflected on my pregnancy I realized that my husband doesn't want this baby. He's taken amazing care of me, I'll never try to argue otherwise. He does everything that I ask of him, he's been kind and patient when I'm having a hard time and never complains about picking up extra work around our house. But when it comes to the baby, he has absolutely nothing to say.

To start with, he never asks how the baby is doing. I go to most of my OBGYN appointments alone and when I come back from them he'll ask how I'M doing and seem concerned and engaged, but any time I try to talk about how the baby is doing he changes the subject or just silently nods along until I stop talking. His excuse is always that he "isn't worried because you're not worried". I try to talk about baby names, he just tells me he's sure I'll pick a good one. I've cried to him about him not wanting to talk about the baby and he'll engage for maybe a day or throw out a name (often ones ive already said I don't like) and then will stop. 

We've gotten into countless arguments about unprepared he is for fatherhood/taking care of a baby. My husband is the youngest in his family so he's never even held a baby before. I tired to get him involved in parenting classes, birthing classes, buy him books, send him videos, give him questions he can ask other father's in his life, ANYTHING to prepare him. He tells me he'll go to the class, read the book, ask the questions, and then a few weeks later he'll tell me he 'forgot'. Every other month we'll have a huge argument about how he hasn't done anything and he'll swear up and down he'll change and then never does.

I did the pregnancy announcement myself, I did the gender reveal myself, I did the baby registry myself, I did the baby show myself. He'd tell me he would help but never even suggested anything. The most he ever did was pay for things. 

At five months, I got fed up and asked if he wanted the baby at all. He claimed he did, and when I pointed out that he has done nothing to show me he's interested in the baby at all he just told me he didn't know why he wasn't doing anything. When I suggested giving the baby up for adoption or having an abortion, he had the worst emotional meltdown I've ever seen him have. He broke down crying and screaming that the baby meant more to him than anything and all he wanted to do was be a father. He wouldn't talk to me for two days after that, then came back to tell me he'd respect whatever decision I made but he really wanted the baby. I decided to continue my pregnancy, but it's like he became even more disconnected after that.

Last week, after finding out he still hadnt attended any classes or even opened any of the books I gave him I finally snapped and told him he was acting like his father. I said the the baby wasn't even born yet and he was already absent and cold toward our son. He got really upset and told me that he loved me and did everything for me, and gave me everything that I wanted. When I told him that there was a difference between loving me and loving the baby he seemed really confused. He just kept repeating that he'd do anything for me and just wanted me to be happy.

I tried to tell him that I feel like he only got me pregnant to make me happy and he quickly shut me down and said he wanted to be a dad before he even met me. He also pointed out that if it was his decision, we'd have three more kids and I was the one who wanted to stop at one. While that's true, I just don't find it relevant to anything.

I love my husband deeply. He's always treated me well and been my biggest supporter in life. Up until now, we've had a beautiful relationship and nothing has come between us since we met. But I also love my son, and I know that if I have to choose between them I'm picking my child. I don't want to have to make a choice like that, but I genuinely don't know what to do. 

To me, it feels like my husband thought he wanted a baby until we got pregnant and now he feels like he can't take it back or I'll be upset. Its so hard to believe that these are the actions of someone that wants to be a day, but I guess I could be wrong. Why would he be acting like this if he does want the baby? What am I supposed to do now? He's a great partner outside of this and our relationship has been closer than ever so what is going on?



Tldr; I think my husband only got me pregnant to make me happy

ExGF still looks amazing, is easy to chat with, laughs at my jokes and seems like she understands me. ExGF even said that we made a cute couple.

ExGF is currently single, so that is not helping me. ExGF knows I'm married with kids, knows things aren't awesome at home, and isn't nagging or judging me, that I know of. Kid #1's birth and first year were traumatic with time in the NICU and all the fun of a preemie. 

Other information that comes into play. Had a best friend, 42M, that didn't like exGF, so after my divorce, he made sure to tell me not to contact her. His influence was overbearing in my life and he hasn't been around in almost a decade. There were decisions I made during our friendship that didn't reflect my character and I have been questioning a lot of things during that time of my life. ExGF's mom loved me and was brought up by exGF in the last month. ExGF hasn't had a BF earn that since. My family loved exGF too. She set the bar and no one else has tied or surpassed. 

Strangers of reddit, I come to you looking for help. Am I delusional and letting nostalgia cloud my vision? Do I need to discontinue messaging exGF? Do I need to end the marriage and pursue happiness? Do I cheat and wait until that bomb explodes and cleanup my mess afterwards? Is the exGF my Robin and I'm her Ted from HIMYM? Is there another option I am missing?

tl;dr - feeling stuck in current life and marriage, exGF recently surfaced and I feel happiness for what could have been. Or it's nostalgia. Or I'm gassy. Asking for help from those not emotionally tied to anyone or fiscally responsible for the outcome.
